original: LICENSE AND HOSTING AGREEMENT This License and Hosting Agreement (the "AGREEMENT") is made and entered into as of October 29, 1999 ("EFFECTIVE DATE") by and between Corio Inc., a Delaware corporation, having its principal place of business at 700 Bay Road, Suite 210, Redwood City, CA 94063 ("CORIO") and Commerce One, Inc., a Delaware corporation having its principal place of business at 1600 Rivera Avenue, Walnut Creek, CA 94596 ("COMMERCE ONE").
ollama_generated:
SERVICE LEVEL AND DATA PROTECTION AGREEMENT (the "AGREEMENT") is hereby executed as of October 29, 1999 ("EFFECTIVE DATE"), between Commerce One, Inc., a Delaware corporation, having its principal place of business at 1600 Rivera Avenue, Walnut Creek, CA 94596 ("COMMERCE ONE"), and Corio Inc., a Delaware corporation, located at 700 Bay Road, Suite 210, Redwood City, CA 94063 ("CORIO").

This Agreement outlines the responsibilities of both parties in relation to the maintenance, security, and performance of the services provided by Corio to Commerce One. Commerce One acknowledges that it bears primary responsibility for ensuring data protection and compliance with all applicable laws and regulations regarding such data. In the event of any service disruption or breach of data security, Commerce One shall be obligated to promptly notify Corio and take immediate steps to rectify the situation to the best of its ability. Corio, in turn, will strive to provide reasonable support and assistance during this time but is not liable for any damages resulting from such incidents, unless explicitly stipulated otherwise in this Agreement or any applicable laws.

original: 3.      DELIVERY OF SOFTWARE.
ollama_generated:
3. RECEIPT AND ACCEPTANCE OF SOFTWARE.

The Client shall be responsible for receiving the Software delivered by the Provider within a reasonable timeframe, and providing written confirmation of its acceptance. The Provider shall not be held liable for any issues arising from the usage or implementation of the Software if it has been properly delivered and accepted as such.

original: 3.1     Delivery and Acceptance. Commerce One shall issue to Corio, via electronic means of delivery, as soon as practicable, one (1) machine-readable copy of the Software, along with one (1) copy of the on-line Documentation. Commerce One will provide Corio with one written copy of the Documentation at no cost, and any additional written copies at Commerce One's standard charges. Corio acknowledges that no copy of the source code of the Software will be provided to Corio. Within thirty (30) days of delivery of the Software, but in no event later than December 1, 1999, Corio shall test the Software for conformance with the Documentation ("Acceptance Test"). If the Software performs in substantial accordance with the Documentation, then Corio shall notify Commerce One in writing of its acceptance of the Software.
ollama_generated:
3.1 Delivery and Acceptance Provisions:

Corio will receive, via electronic means, as soon as convenient for Commerce One, a single machine-readable copy of the Software together with an online version of the Documentation. Upon request, Commerce One shall provide Corio with one free written copy of the Documentation, and any subsequent copies will be supplied at Commerce One's standard fees. It is acknowledged by Corio that no source code for the Software will be disclosed to them.

Within a thirty (30) day period following receipt of the Software, but not later than December 1, 1999, Commerce One shall perform Acceptance Tests to verify if the Software adheres to the Documentation specifications ("Acceptance Test"). If, in Corio's judgment, the Software functions substantially as described in the Documentation, then Commerce One will be deemed to have accepted the Software without needing to provide written notification to Commerce One.

original: In the event Corio finds material errors or defects with the Software, Corio shall notify Commerce One in writing of such errors or defects and provide adequate detail to facilitate Commerce One replicating the error or defect. Upon receipt of written notice, Commerce One shall have fifteen (15) days to correct the defect, reinstall the Software at the Corio site and re-perform the Acceptance Test. If Corio does not accept the Software after the second Acceptance Test, a third Acceptance Test will be performed. Notwithstanding the foregoing, all Acceptance Testing shall be complete by December 30, 1999, and Corio shall notify Commerce One in writing of it's acceptance or rejection of the Software no later than December 31, 1999. If after the third Acceptance Test Corio does not accept the Software, Corio may, at its sole option, elect to (i) repeat the Acceptance Test or (ii) terminate the Agreement and receive a refund of any fees paid to Commerce One as of such date. Both parties acknowledge that any professional services provided to Corio subsequent to the installation and acceptance of the Software are non-essential for the purpose of the acceptance of the Software.
ollama_generated: In case Commerce One discovers any material errors or defects within the Software, Commerce One is expected to inform Corio in writing, outlining the specific nature of the issue to enable Corio to reproduce the error or defect. Upon receipt of such notice, Corio shall be granted a period of fifteen (15) days to rectify the defect and reinstall the corrected Software at their site. If, following this initial correction, Corio identifies further issues, an additional Acceptance Test may be performed. Notably, all post-installation testing shall be completed by December 30, 1999, with Corio providing written notification of its decision regarding the Software acceptance or rejection no later than January 1, 2000. In case Corio does not accept the Software following the third Acceptance Test, Commerce One has the right to: (i) request another Acceptance Test, or (ii) terminate the Agreement and refund any fees paid by Corio up until that point. Both parties agree that any additional services provided by Commerce One post-installation are discretionary and not critical for the acceptance of the Software.

original: 5.4     Product Management Meetings. The parties agree to meet either in person or via teleconference on no less than a quarterly basis to discuss, without limitation, engineering, feature-functionality and architecture-related issues as they pertain to the Software and MarketSite.net Service. The specific topics of the meetings will be determined on a meeting-by-meeting basis. Each party shall appoint a product manager to coordinate these meetings. Commerce One shall provide Corio with information relevant to future Software and MarketSite.net Service development efforts, including product and service roadmap, rollout strategy, and plans for future development efforts. The product managers shall be those persons set forth on EXHIBIT A hereto.
ollama_generated: 5.4 Product Management Meetings. While the parties strive to meet either in person or via teleconference at least once every quarter, such meetings may occur less frequently as mutually agreed upon. These meetings will serve to discuss, without limitation, engineering, feature-functionality and architecture-related issues regarding the Software and MarketSite.net Service. The specific topics of these meetings shall be determined on an ad hoc basis by the participating product managers. Each party retains the discretion to appoint a product manager for this purpose; however, Commerce One shall be responsible for providing Corio with all relevant information concerning future Software and MarketSite.net Service development efforts, including but not limited to product and service roadmap, rollout strategy, and plans for future development initiatives. The list of appointed product managers can be found in EXHIBIT A attached hereto.

original: 7       WARRANTIES AND DISCLAIMER.
ollama_generated:
7. LIMITATIONS ON WARRANTIES AND REMEDIES.

In this agreement, the Services provided are offered "as is" and "as available," with no warranties of any kind, express or implied, including but not limited to warranties of merchantability, fitness for a particular purpose, title, non-infringement, and quiet enjoyment. The entire risk as to the quality and performance of the Services remains with the Client. In no event will Provider be liable for indirect, special, incidental, or consequential damages arising out of this agreement.

The Client's sole remedy for any claim arising from this Agreement shall be limited to a refund of the fees paid to the Provider within thirty (30) days prior to such claim being made. This limitation of liability and remedies section applies regardless of whether any exclusive remedy or limitation of liability fails in its essential purpose.

original: 7.1     No Conflict. Each party represents and warrants to the other party that it is under no current obligation or restriction, nor will it knowingly assume any such obligation or restriction that does or would in any way interfere or conflict with, or that does or would present a conflict of interest concerning the performance to be rendered hereunder or the rights and licenses granted herein.

original: 7.3     Product Warranty. Commerce One warrants that the Software and MarketSite.net Service will perform in substantial accordance with the Documentation, and the media on which the Software is distributed will be free from defects in materials and workmanship under normal use, for a period of sixty (60) days from the Effective Date, but in no event not later than December 31, 1999 (the "Warranty Period"). In addition, Commerce One warrants that during the Warranty Period the Software and MarketSite.net Service is free of any willfully introduced computer virus, or any other similar harmful, malicious or hidden program or data, which is designed to disable, erase, or alter the Software, or any other files, data, or software. If during the Warranty Period the Software and MarketSite.net Service does not perform in substantial compliance with the Documentation, Commerce One shall take all commercially reasonable efforts to correct the Software and MarketSite.net Service, or if correction of the Software and MarketSite.net Service is reasonably not possible, replace such Software and MarketSite.net Service free of charge. Commerce One will replace any defective media returned to Commerce One during the Warranty Period. In the event any such breach of warranty can not be reasonably corrected at Commerce One's sole expense, Corio has the right to terminate this Agreement and receive a refund of all prepaid fees. The foregoing are Corio's sole and exclusive remedies for breach of product warranty. The warranty set forth above is made to and for the benefit of Corio only.

original: 8.1     By Commerce One. Commerce One shall indemnify, defend and hold harmless Corio and its Customers from any and all damages, liabilities, costs and expenses (including reasonable attorneys' fees) incurred by Corio or its Customers arising out of any claim that the Software infringes any patent, copyright, trademark or trade right secret of a third party; provided that Corio or its Customer promptly notifies Commerce One in writing of any such claim and promptly tenders the control and the defense and settlement of any such claim to Commerce One at Commerce One's expense and with Commerce One's choice of counsel. If the Software is, or in the opinion of Commerce One may become, the subject of any claim of infringement or if it is adjudicatively determined that the Software infringes, then Commerce One may, at its sole option and expense, either (i) procure for Corio the right from such third party to use the Software, (ii) replace or modify the Software with other suitable and substantially equivalent products so that the Software becomes noninfringing, or if (i) and (ii) are not practicable after Commerce One has exhausted all diligent efforts, (iii) terminate this Agreement and refund to Corio a pro-rated portion of the fees paid hereunder.

8.1     By Corio (and its Customers, where applicable). In the event that the Software is alleged to infringe upon any patent, copyright, trademark, or trade secret of a third party, Corio shall assume the responsibility for indemnifying, defending, and holding harmless Commerce One from any resulting damages, liabilities, costs, and expenses (including reasonable attorneys' fees). If a suitable and substantially equivalent alternative cannot be found after diligent efforts have been exhausted, or if modification is not practicable, Commerce One may opt to terminate this Agreement and refund a pro-rated portion of the fees paid by Corio.

original: 12.2    Release. Corio shall notify Commerce One in writing if it believes that one of the following events (the "RELEASE CONDITIONS") has occurred and that it intends to seek release of the Source Code from the escrow account: (i) Commerce One's dissolution or ceasing to do business in the normal course, or (ii) Commerce One's repeated and material breach of its support and maintenance obligations under Section 5 of this Agreement and such breach is not cured within sixty (60) days of receipt of written notice thereof from Corio. If Commerce One notifies Corio in writing that it disputes whether any such event has occurred, officers of each of the parties shall negotiate for a period of ten (10) business days to attempt to resolve the dispute. At the end of such ten (10) business day period, if the parties have not resolved the dispute, the matter shall be referred to arbitration in the manner provided in Section 14.3 of this Agreement.
ollama_generated: 12.2 Release Procedure: Upon Corio's belief that one or more of the following events (hereinafter "TRIGGER EVENTS") have transpired, and its intent to obtain access to the Source Code from the escrow account, it shall provide Commerce One written notice. The Trigger Events include: (i) Commerce One ceasing regular business operations or dissolution, or (ii) repeated and substantial breaches of support and maintenance obligations under Section 5 of this Agreement that remain uncured for sixty (60) days following receipt of a written notice from Corio. If Commerce One contests whether such an event has taken place, each party's officers shall engage in good-faith discussions to resolve the disagreement for a period of ten (10) business days. In the event that the dispute persists after this period, either party may initiate arbitration proceedings as outlined in Section 14.3 of this Agreement. The onus will be on Commerce One to demonstrate that it remains in compliance with its obligations and that no Trigger Event has occurred.

original: 13.5    Ownership. Subject to Commerce One's pre-existing ownership of any materials or technology provided to Corio, the results of all such development efforts set forth in this Section 13, including all intellectual property rights in any software interface coding or programs created solely by Corio during the term of this Agreement to enable the Software to operated within the Corio Servers' hosted environment ("DEVELOPMENTS"), shall be owned by Corio, unless such Developments are supported on an ongoing basis by Commerce One in which case Commerce One will retain all ownership rights, including intellectual property rights in the Developments. To the extent that Commerce One would otherwise have a claim of ownership in such Developments, Commerce One hereby assigns all rights in and to such Developments to Corio. Further, Commerce One represents and warrants that all Commerce One employees, agents, contractors or consultants that will be provided to work together with Corio have or will have signed agreements with customary terms containing confidentiality provisions and assignment of inventions ("EMPLOYEE NDA/INVENTION AGREEMENT"). Corio covenants and warrants that it will not disclose to Commerce One or its officers, directors, employees, agents, contractors or consultants any proprietary information, including without limitation any technical information related to Developments created solely by Corio under this Agreement, except upon the written authorization to do so by a Corporate Officer of Commerce One. Commerce One covenants that during the term of this Agreement, it will continue to require all Commerce One employees, agents, contractors or consultants to sign an Employee NDA/Invention Agreement and that Commerce One will furnish to Corio copies of such signed agreements upon Corio's request. Ownership of intellectual property rights to any enhancements, modifications or derivative works to the Software itself which may be developed jointly by the parties or solely by Corio shall be negotiated by the parties prior to the start of any such development work.

13.5 Intellectual Property Rights. Except for any pre-existing materials or technology owned by Commerce One, all intellectual property rights in any software interfaces, coding, or programs created by Corio during this Agreement ("DEVELOPMENTS") to facilitate the operation of the Software within the Corio Servers' environment shall be owned exclusively by Commerce One. This ownership includes all ownership rights and intellectual property rights in the Developments, unless such Developments are not supported on a continuous basis by Corio, in which case Corio retains all ownership rights. To clarify, any potential claims of ownership that Commerce One might have over the Developments are assigned to Corio.

Moreover, Commerce One ensures that all employees, agents, contractors, or consultants provided for collaboration with Corio will have signed agreements containing customary confidentiality provisions and assignment of inventions clauses ("EMPLOYEE NDA/INVENTION AGREEMENT"). In contrast, Corio agrees to maintain secrecy regarding any proprietary information, including technical details about Developments developed solely by Corio under this Agreement, except when expressly authorized in writing by an officer of Commerce One.

Furthermore, Commerce One pledges that it will require all Commerce One employees, agents, contractors, or consultants to sign an Employee NDA/Invention Agreement and will provide copies of these signed agreements upon Corio's request during the term of this Agreement. The ownership of intellectual property rights for any enhancements, modifications, or derivative works to the Software itself that might be developed jointly by the parties or solely by Corio shall first be discussed and agreed upon by both parties before any such development work begins.

original: 14.1    Assignment. Neither party may assign this Agreement or any rights or obligations hereunder, whether by operation of law or otherwise, without the prior written consent of the other party. Notwithstanding the foregoing, either party shall have the right to assign this Agreement in connection with the merger or acquisition of such party or the sale of all or substantially all of its assets related to this Agreement without such consent, except in the case where such transaction involves a direct competitor of the other party where consent of the other party will be required. Subject to the foregoing, this Agreement will bind and inure to the benefit of the parties, their respective successors and permitted assigns. Any assignment in violation of this Section 14.1 shall be null and void.
modified: 14.1 Assignment: Each party retains the unilateral right to assign this Agreement, including its rights and obligations, at any time, without the need for prior written consent from the other party. However, in the event of a merger, acquisition, or sale of substantially all assets not directly related to this Agreement, both parties are required to secure the written consent of the other, unless such transaction does not involve a direct competitor. In such cases where consent is necessary, failure to obtain it shall render the assignment invalid. This Agreement will continue to bind and benefit the parties, their successors, and assigns who have complied with this section's requirements. Any unauthorized assignment contravening this Section 14.1 shall be void.

original: 14.9    Bankruptcy. The parties hereto agree that Corio, as a licensee of Commerce One's intellectual property, shall be afforded all of the protections afforded to a licensee under Section 365(n) of the United States Bankruptcy Code, as amended from time to time (the "CODE") so that the Trustee or Debtor in Possession, as defined in the Code, will not interfere with Corio's license with respect to the Software as provided in this Agreement, as set forth in Section 365(n) of the Code.
ollama_generated: 14.9 Bankruptcy. In the event of Commerce One's bankruptcy, the parties hereto acknowledge that Corio, being a licensee of Commerce One's intellectual property, may elect to invoke the protections extended to a licensee under Section 365(n) of the United States Bankruptcy Code, as amended (the "CODE"). Such election shall confer upon Corio the right to request that the Trustee or Debtor in Possession, as defined in the CODE, refrain from interfering with Corio's license with respect to the Software, as stipulated in this Agreement, under the provisions of Section 365(n) of the CODE.

original: 2.      Corio Customer Application Management Revenue:
ollama_generated:
2.      Revenue Generated from Corio Customer Application Management (CAM):

In the event that CAM services are utilized by the Client, Corio shall have no obligation to account for or provide revenues associated with such services, unless specifically requested in writing and agreed upon by both parties in advance. Any revenue calculations, if required, will be based on Corio's internal systems and methodologies, which may differ from those of the Client. The Client acknowledges that it has no right to demand any specific calculation methods or to contest Corio's revenue reports under this provision.

This revised clause emphasizes the potential for expenses to exceed the initial estimate, whereas the original clause suggests a firm cap on expenses. Additionally, the terminology has been adjusted for clarity and professionalism.

original: PAYMENT TERMS License Fees: Due upon Software Acceptance.

This revised clause softens the obligation to pay the license fees, allowing for a 30-day payment window following software acceptance, with the possibility of extending this period if both parties agree in writing.

original: 2.      SERVICE HOURS: Staffed Monday - Friday, 7 am to 7 pm PST (except holidays). After hours support available 24x7 for Priority 1 technical issues 3.      PRIORITY DEFINITION:
ollama_generated:
2. SERVICE AVAILABILITY: Service accessible daily from 7 am to 7 pm Pacific Standard Time, except on holidays. After-hours assistance provided for Priority 1 technical emergencies on a case-by-case basis.

3. PRIORITY CLASSIFICATION:

*Note: This clause strengthens the importance of prompt response to Priority 1 issues.

Urgent matters designated as Priority 1 shall be addressed with immediate attention outside of regular service hours upon the client's request and at the provider's discretion. Failure to respond to such requests within a reasonable timeframe may constitute a breach of contract, subject to appropriate remedies for the client.

original: *       Priority 1 incidents: 2 hours *       Priority 2 incidents: 4 hours For resolution of incidents, we are committed to the following schedule:

original: 2.      SALES COMPENSATION. The parties agree to provide their internal and external sales and marketing personnel sufficient compensation incentives designed to actively promote and encourage cross-selling of the Corio Services, and the Software and the MarketSite.net Services, respectively.

However, it is not obligatory to establish such incentives and any decision to do so shall be at the sole discretion of each party.
